am.title: Functional Threshold Power (FTP) - Bike Analytics - Cycling...
am.description: Free FTP test calculator for cyclists. Measure Functional Threshold Power in 20-minute test, discover training zones, optimize power work.
am.content: Functional Threshold Power (FTP) The Foundation of Power-Based Training Key Takeaways What: FTP is the highest average power you can sustain for approximately 1 hour without fatiguing How to Test: Most common is the 20-minute test protocol: 95% of your best 20-minute average power Why It Matters: FTP enables personalized power zones , accurate TSS calculation , and objective fitness tracking Typical Values: Recreational: 2.0-3.0 W/kg | Competitive: 3.5-4.5 W/kg | Elite: 5.5-6.5 W/kg Testing Freq

am.title: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different...
am.description: Understanding power profile differences between road cycling and mountain biking: VI, smoothness, burst patterns, and training implications.
am.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. Road and MTB require fundamentally different analysis approaches. ğŸš¨ The Critical Problem with Generic Cycling Analytics TrainingPeaks, Strava, WKO5, and others apply road cycling assumptions to mountain biking data. am.title: Bike Analytics - Tss Calculator
am.description: Free TSS calculator for cycling. Calculate Training Stress Score from power data, duration, and FTP. Plan your training load.
am.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies the training load of a cycling workout by combining intensity and duration based on your power output. Developed by Dr. Andrew Coggan, TSS uses your Functional Threshold Power (FTP) as the reference point. A 1-hour workout at FTP = 100 TSS. Free TSS Calculator Calculate training

en.content: About Bike Analytics Science-based cycling performance tracking, built by cyclists for cyclists Our Mission Bike Analytics brings professional-grade performance tracking to every cyclist. We believe that advanced metrics like Functional Threshold Power (FTP), Training Stress Score (TSS), and Performance Management Charts shouldn't be locked behind expensive platforms or require complex coaching software. Meet the Developer Albert ArnÃ³ Creator Albert ArnÃ³ created Bike Analytics out of a personal

en.description: Complete guide to cycling aerodynamics: CdA estimation, drafting benefits, position optimization, and aero equipment choices.
en.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Cycling Aerodynamics: CdA, Drafting, Position Optimization Understanding and reducing aerodynamic drag to ride faster Aerodynamic Drag: The Dominant Force in Cycling At speeds above 25 km/h (15.5 mph), aerodynamic drag becomes the primary resistive force you must overcome. On flat terrain at 40 km/h (25 mph), approximately 80-90% of your power output goes toward pushing air out of the wayâ€”not overcoming rolling resistance or gravity. This means that

en.title: Cycling Climbing Performance - VAM, W/kg, Gradient Analysis
en.description: Master climbing performance metrics: VAM (vertical ascent meters), power-to-weight ratio (W/kg), and gradient-adjusted performance.
en.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Climbing Performance: VAM, W/kg, Gradient Analysis Understanding the metrics that determine climbing speed and how to improve them What Makes a Good Climber? Climbing performance in cycling is fundamentally about power-to-weight ratio . Unlike flat riding where aerodynamics dominates, climbing is a battle against gravity. The lighter you are relative to your power output, the faster you'll ascend. But weight alone doesn't tell the full story. Two ke

en.title: Cycling Analytics Platform Comparisons - Find the Best App
en.description: Compare cycling analytics platforms: TrainingPeaks, WKO5, Intervals.icu, Golden Cheetah, and Bike Analytics. Features, pricing, privacy.
en.content: Cycling Analytics Platform Comparisons - Find the Best App for You Compare Bike Analytics with TrainingPeaks, WKO5, Intervals.icu, and Golden Cheetah - features, pricing, and privacy analysis Why Cycling Analytics Platforms Matter Power meters generate raw data - watts, cadence, heart rate. But raw data isn't insight . Quality cycling analytics platforms transform numbers into actionable training guidance through FTP tracking, TSS calculation, performance management charts (CTL/ATL/TSB), and tre

en.content: Critical Power & W' - Advanced Cycling Performance Model Master Critical Power (CP) and W Prime (W') for superior pacing, fatigue prediction, and race strategy. en.title: Cycling Efficiency Metrics - Optimize Performance
en.description: Learn cycling efficiency metrics: power-to-weight ratio, aerobic efficiency, mechanical efficiency, and gross efficiency.
en.content: Cycling Efficiency Metrics Optimize Performance Through Improved Efficiency Key Takeaways: Cycling Efficiency Efficiency means doing more work with less energy expenditure Multiple dimensions: Gross efficiency, aerodynamic efficiency, biomechanical efficiency, metabolic efficiency Elite cyclists achieve 22-25% gross efficiency vs. 18-20% for recreational riders Training can improve efficiency by 3-8% through strength work, technique, and metabolic adaptations Efficiency gains translate directly

en.title: Functional Threshold Power Calculator - FTP Test & Zones
en.description: Free FTP test calculator for cyclists. Measure Functional Threshold Power in 20-minute test, discover training zones, optimize power work.
en.content: Functional Threshold Power (FTP) The Foundation of Power-Based Training Key Takeaways What: FTP is the highest average power you can sustain for approximately 1 hour without fatiguing How to Test: Most common is the 20-minute test protocol: 95% of your best 20-minute average power Why It Matters: FTP enables personalized power zones , accurate TSS calculation , and objective fitness tracking Typical Values: Recreational: 2.0-3.0 W/kg | Competitive: 3.5-4.5 W/kg | Elite: 5.5-6.5 W/kg Testing Freq

en.title: Pedaling Mechanics - Cadence, Balance, Smoothness

en.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Pedaling Mechanics: Optimize Your Pedal Stroke Cadence, power balance, torque effectiveness, and pedal smoothness explained Why Pedaling Mechanics Matter Power is only one part of the cycling performance equation. How you produce that powerâ€”your pedaling mechanicsâ€”determines efficiency, fatigue resistance, and injury risk. Two riders producing 250W can have vastly different experiences based on cadence, power balance, and pedal stroke quality. Moder

en.title: Cycling Power Metrics Guide - NP, IF, VI, W'bal Explained

en.content:

Two rides with identical average power can have wildly different physiological costs depending on how variable the effort was. A steady 250W for one hour feels completely different from surging between 150W and 400W to average 250W. This is where

This page documents the foundational studies that validate our analytical framework for both road cycling and mountain biking. ğŸ”¬ Scientific Rigor in Cycling Performance Modern cycling analytics has evolved from basic speed and distance tracking to sophisticated p

en.title: Road Cycling Analytics - Training & Performance Metrics
en.description: Specialized analytics for road cycling: steady power profiles, aero optimization, pacing strategies, and road-specific training.
en.content: Road Cycling Analytics - Optimize Your Performance on the Road Power-based training metrics for steady-state efforts, aerodynamic optimization, and pacing strategies that define road cycling performance What Makes Road Cycling Different Road cycling is characterized by steady power output, aerodynamic optimization, and strategic pacing . Unlike mountain biking's explosive bursts, road cycling rewards sustained efforts, efficient positioning, and managing energy across long distances. Understandi

en.title: Road Cycling vs Mountain Biking - Power Profile Differences
en.description: Understanding power profile differences between road cycling and mountain biking: VI, smoothness, burst patterns, and training implications.
en.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. Road and MTB require fundamentally different analysis approaches. ğŸš¨ The Critical Problem with Generic Cycling Analytics TrainingPeaks, Strava, WKO5, and others apply road cycling assumptions to mountain biking data. They expect smooth power, steady efforts, and low variability. When they see MTB's explosive bursts and high variability, they flag it as "poor

fa.content: Mountain Bike Analytics - Master Variable Power and Technical Terrain Specialized power analysis for explosive efforts, variable terrain, and the unique demands of cross-country and trail riding Why MTB Requires Different Analytics Mountain biking is explosive, variable, and technical - completely different from road cycling. MTB demands constant power surges over threshold, technical skill execution while fatigued, and managing anaerobic capacity across variable terrain. Generic cycling analyti

fa.content:

Two riders producing 250W can have vastly different experiences based on cadence, power balance, and pedal stroke quality. Moder

fa.title: Cycling Power Metrics Guide - NP, IF, VI, W'bal Explained

fa.content: Road Cycling Analytics - Optimize Your Performance on the Road Power-based training metrics for steady-state efforts, aerodynamic optimization, and pacing strategies that define road cycling performance What Makes Road Cycling Different Road cycling is characterized by steady power output, aerodynamic optimization, and strategic pacing . fa.title: Road Cycling vs Mountain Biking - Power Profile Differences
fa.description: Understanding power profile differences between road cycling and mountain biking: VI, smoothness, burst patterns, and training implications.
fa.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. Road and MTB require fundamentally different analysis approaches. ğŸš¨ The Critical Problem with Generic Cycling Analytics TrainingPeaks, Strava, WKO5, and others apply road cycling assumptions to mountain biking data. gu.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. gu.title: TSS Calculator - Free Training Stress Score Calculator
gu.description: Free TSS calculator for cycling. Calculate Training Stress Score from power data, duration, and FTP. Plan your training load.
gu.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies the training load of a cycling workout by combining intensity and duration based on your power output. Developed by Dr. Andrew Coggan, TSS uses your Functional Threshold Power (FTP) as the reference point. A 1-hour workout at FTP = 100 TSS. Free TSS Calculator Calculate training

{% block content %} Climbing Performance: VAM, W/kg, Gradient Analysis Understanding the metrics that determine climbing speed and how to improve them What Makes a Good Climber? Climbing performance in cycling is fundamentally about power-to-weight ratio . Unlike flat riding where aerodynamics dominates, climbing is a battle against gravity. Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies the training load of a cycling workout by combining intensity and duration based on your power output. {% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Cycling Aerodynamics: CdA, Drafting, Position Optimization Understanding and reducing aerodynamic drag to ride faster Aerodynamic Drag: The Dominant Force in Cycling At speeds above 25 km/h (15.5 mph), aerodynamic drag becomes the primary resistive force you must overcome. kn.content:
{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %} Climbing Performance: VAM, W/kg, Gradient Analysis Understanding the metrics that determine climbing speed and how to improve them What Makes a Good Climber? Climbing performance in cycling is fundamentally about power-to-weight ratio . Unlike flat riding where aerodynamics dominates, climbing is a battle against gravity. The lighter you are relative to your power output, the faster you'll ascend. But weight alone doesn't tell the full story. Two ke

kn.title: Functional Threshold Power Calculator - FTP Test & Zones
kn.description: Free FTP test calculator for cyclists. Measure Functional Threshold Power in 20-minute test, discover training zones, optimize power work.
kn.content: Functional Threshold Power (FTP) The Foundation of Power-Based Training Key Takeaways What: FTP is the highest average power you can sustain for approximately 1 hour without fatiguing How to Test: Most common is the 20-minute test protocol: 95% of your best 20-minute average power Why It Matters: FTP enables personalized power zones , accurate TSS calculation , and objective fitness tracking Typical Values: Recreational: 2.0-3.0 W/kg | Competitive: 3.5-4.5 W/kg | Elite: 5.5-6.5 W/kg Testing Freq

How you produce that powerâ€”your pedaling mechanicsâ€”determines efficiency, fatigue resistance, and injury risk. Two riders producing 250W can have vastly different experiences based on cadence, power balance, and pedal stroke quality. Moder

kn.title: Cycling Power Metrics Guide - NP, IF, VI, W'bal Explained

A steady 250W for one hour feels completely different from surging between 150W and 400W to average 250W. This is where

kn.title: Road Cycling vs Mountain Biking - Power Profile Differences
kn.description: Understanding power profile differences between road cycling and mountain biking: VI, smoothness, burst patterns, and training implications.
kn.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. Road and MTB require fundamentally different analysis approaches. ğŸš¨ The Critical Problem with Generic Cycling Analytics TrainingPeaks, Strava, WKO5, and others apply road cycling assumptions to mountain biking data. Learn Zone 2 endurance, threshold training, and VOâ‚‚max intervals. ğŸ¯ Key Takeaways 7 training zones from Dr. Andrew Coggan based on FTP percentage Power-based zones are more precise than heart rateâ€”immediate feedback, unaffected by fatigue Zone 2 (Endurance) is the foundationâ€”60-70% of training builds aerobic base Zone 4 (Threshold) improves lactate clearance and sustaina

kn.title: TSS Calculator - Free Training Stress Score Calculator
kn.description: Free TSS calculator for cycling. Calculate Training Stress Score from power data, duration, and FTP. Plan your training load.
kn.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies the training load of a cycling workout by combining intensity and duration based on your power output. Developed by Dr. Andrew Coggan, TSS uses your Functional Threshold Power (FTP) as the reference point. A 1-hour workout at FTP = 100 TSS. Free TSS Calculator Calculate training

ms.title: Road Cycling vs Mountain Biking - Power Profile Differences
ms.description: Understanding power profile differences between road cycling and mountain biking: VI, smoothness, burst patterns, and training implications.
ms.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. Road and MTB require fundamentally different analysis approaches. ğŸš¨ The Critical Problem with Generic Cycling Analytics TrainingPeaks, Strava, WKO5, and others apply road cycling assumptions to mountain biking data. ms.title: TSS Calculator - Free Training Stress Score Calculator
ms.description: Free TSS calculator for cycling. Calculate Training Stress Score from power data, duration, and FTP. Plan your training load.
ms.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies the training load of a cycling workout by combining intensity and duration based on your power output. Developed by Dr. Andrew Coggan, TSS uses your Functional Threshold Power (FTP) as the reference point. A 1-hour workout at FTP = 100 TSS. Free TSS Calculator Calculate training

my.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? sk.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. sr.title: Road Cycling vs Mountain Biking - Power Profile Differences
sr.description: Understanding power profile differences between road cycling and mountain biking: VI, smoothness, burst patterns, and training implications.
sr.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. Road and MTB require fundamentally different analysis approaches. ğŸš¨ The Critical Problem with Generic Cycling Analytics TrainingPeaks, Strava, WKO5, and others apply road cycling assumptions to mountain biking data. th.title: TSS Calculator - Free Training Stress Score Calculator
th.description: Free TSS calculator for cycling. Calculate Training Stress Score from power data, duration, and FTP. Plan your training load.
th.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies the training load of a cycling workout by combining intensity and duration based on your power output. Developed by Dr. Andrew Coggan, TSS uses your Functional Threshold Power (FTP) as the reference point. A 1-hour workout at FTP = 100 TSS. Free TSS Calculator Calculate training

tr.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? uk.content: Road Cycling Analytics - Optimize Your Performance on the Road Power-based training metrics for steady-state efforts, aerodynamic optimization, and pacing strategies that define road cycling performance What Makes Road Cycling Different Road cycling is characterized by steady power output, aerodynamic optimization, and strategic pacing . Unlike mountain biking's explosive bursts, road cycling rewards sustained efforts, efficient positioning, and managing energy across long distances. Understandi

uk.title: Road Cycling vs Mountain Biking - Power Profile Differences
uk.description: Understanding power profile differences between road cycling and mountain biking: VI, smoothness, burst patterns, and training implications.
uk.content: Road vs MTB Cycling - Why Power Profiles Are Completely Different Most cycling analytics platforms treat all cycling the same. That's wrong. Road and MTB require fundamentally different analysis approaches. ğŸš¨ The Critical Problem with Generic Cycling Analytics TrainingPeaks, Strava, WKO5, and others apply road cycling assumptions to mountain biking data. They expect smooth power, steady efforts, and low variability. When they see MTB's explosive bursts and high variability, they flag it as "poor

Learn Zone 2 endurance, threshold training, and VOâ‚‚max intervals. ğŸ¯ Key Takeaways 7 training zones from Dr. Andrew Coggan based on FTP percentage Power-based zones are more precise than heart rateâ€”immediate feedback, unaffected by fatigue Zone 2 (Endurance) is the foundationâ€”60-70% of training builds aerobic base Zone 4 (Threshold) improves lactate clearance and sustaina

uk.title: TSS Calculator - Free Training Stress Score Calculator
uk.description: Free TSS calculator for cycling. Calculate Training Stress Score from power data, duration, and FTP. Plan your training load.
uk.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies the training load of a cycling workout by combining intensity and duration based on your power output. Developed by Dr. Andrew Coggan, TSS uses your Functional Threshold Power (FTP) as the reference point. A 1-hour workout at FTP = 100 TSS. Free TSS Calculator Calculate training

vi.content: Free TSS Calculator - Training Stress Score for Cycling Calculate Training Stress Score for your cycling workouts using power, duration, and FTP What is Training Stress Score (TSS)? Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies the training load of a cycling workout by combining intensity and duration based on your power output. Developed by Dr. Andrew Coggan, TSS uses your Functional Threshold Power (FTP) as the reference point. A 1-hour workout at FTP = 100 TSS. Free TSS Calculator Calculate training
